result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A. Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Cody A. Turner in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF103 and 14CF107 are heard today.
Amended Information will be provided after Court. Adding Count 3 & 4.  Atty Lloyd waives reading of Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
14CF103 to be DRI
14CF107 Ct 1 to be Dismissed.
Cts 2, 3, 4 & 5 Misd charges: 18 mo probation. Conditions: Pay costs. No contact with Elizabeth H. Perform Community Service.   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Cts 2, 3, 4 & 5 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF107 cts 2, 3, 4, & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 14CF103 is dismissed and Read In

Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lloyd concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:  
Ct 2: w/H 18 mo.  
No contact with Elizabeth Hofstader.
Perform 40 hrs Community Service.   
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs.
Ct 3 W/H 18 mo, concurrent with Ct 2. Same conditions with Ct 2. Pay costs.
Ct 4 W/H 18 mo, concurrent Ct 2 & 3. Same conditions with Ct 2,. Pay costs.
Ct 5 W/H 18 mo, concurrent with Ct 2, 3, & 4. Same conditions with Ct 2. Pay costs.

Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cody A. Turner appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.  Cases 14CF103, 14CF107.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  
Atty Raabe request wage assignment for bonds as parents did not have the money to post.
ADA Knaapen states this not his case and is not familiar with it.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Bond of 14GF77 now 14CF107:  $2,000 Cash Bond:  No contact E. H. or her place of employment or her residence.

3/10/14:  Defendant is no longer allowed the wage assignment and must pay the full $2,000 in order to be released.  Same conditions as previously ordered.

ADA Veronica Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

Court found probable cause over the weekend.
Atty Isherwood states bond recommendations. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant indicates his father is in the Courtroom. 

Bond in this file is covered by 14GF77 which is amended from a signature bond to a cash bond with conditions previously ordered.  

Court will modify the bond to $2,000 cash bail in with the same conditions as previously ordered in 14GF77.
